title: rounded sans on The Slits "Typical Girls" 1979 album cover
content:
Hi,

Can anyone help me identify this face?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150126052826im_/http:/typophile.com/files/slitstypicalgirls_6506.jpg)

Thanks,  
Richard
author: richardm

comments.content: Don’t know font. But. Great band.
That was a great band! But I don't know the font either.
[double post] what does that do to my typophile stats?

(thought i had it, but a check of the design date was all wrong...)

If you're just looking for something similar, you might try Chennai.

I'd say close but no cigar.

[http://www.fonthaus.com/products/fonts/view.cfm/sku/IS10155.cfm](http://web.archive.org/web/20150126052826/http:/www.fonthaus.com/products/fonts/view.cfm/sku/IS10155.cfm "http://www.fonthaus.com/products/fonts/view.cfm/sku/IS10155.cfm")

i know. and it's a drag, cause i enjoy the occassional cigar.

the font is close enough to have inspired Chennai, though. maybe.

Similar also to an old Gem font called Copyright Violation.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150126052826im_/http:/typophile.com/files/slitstypicalgirls_6506_4079.jpg)
Any luck in finding this font 4 years later?

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150126052826im_/http:/typophile.com/files/play_3986.jpg)
  
That cover was a pastiche of the 1960s Ladybird books and appears to use the same typeface. Has that Ladybird font ever been ID'd here?

Justin,

Nice observation, although the 'e' is different.
